channel.title: Help with client
channel.description:
Hey guys im trying to get onto the epicurus rsps server. but im having problems with the client, i hope you guys can help!
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/57EKZwI.png[/img]

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s something with you not setting the IP’s correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @Blaze425 Blaze425
item.description:
@Blaze425 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:528363”]You’re on a windows computer I assume.
Open your user directory.
Looks like:
C:/Users/YOURUSERNAME/
(Replace YOURUSERNAME with your username on your computer.
There should be a folder there titled .DesolutionCache.
Open it, Extract all contents of the cache into it, and just overwrite anything it asks it to.[/quote]
thanks man!!, lol but now i cant connect to the server xD

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re on a windows computer I assume.
Open your user directory.
Looks like:
C:/Users/YOURUSERNAME/
(Replace YOURUSERNAME with your username on your computer.
There should be a folder there titled .DesolutionCache.
Open it, Extract all contents of the cache into it, and just overwrite anything it asks it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @Blaze425 Blaze425
item.description:
@Blaze425 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:528363”]Then someone renamed it or you didn’t look right.
Just look through the signlink.java, there should be something related to the cache directory.[/quote]i found this but idk where it wants me to put it
@Override
public void run() {
uid = 234234234;
active = true;
String s = getCacheLocation();
try {
File file = new File(s + “main_file_cache.dat”);
// if (file.exists() && file.length() > 0x3200000L)
// file.delete();
cache_dat = new RandomAccessFile(s + “main_file_cache.dat”, “rw”);
for (int j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
cache_idx[j] = new RandomAccessFile(s + “main_file_cache.idx” + j, “rw”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Then someone renamed it or you didn’t look right.
Just look through the signlink.java, there should be something related to the cache directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @Blaze425 Blaze425
item.description:
@Blaze425 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:528363”][quote author=Blaze425 link=topic=647114.msg4351823#msg4351823 date=1376784297]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647114.msg4351820#msg4351820 date=1376784232]

Looks like the cache didn’t download correctly.
[/quote]do you think you can help me? you got teamviewer?

Find the link for the cache and download it…
Really, you don’t need to be teamviewed for every issue.
[/quote]I did download the cache and put it in the client folder and it still wont work
would be really helpful if you could teamview

It may not need to go in the client folder.
Open signlink.java And search: findcachedir()
That will tell you the name of the cache and where it goes.[/quote] it did not find anything

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Blaze425, post:5, topic:528363”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647114.msg4351820#msg4351820 date=1376784232]

[quote author=Blaze425 link=topic=647114.msg4351819#msg4351819 date=1376784130]

Looks like the cache didn’t download correctly.
[/quote]do you think you can help me? you got teamviewer?

Find the link for the cache and download it…
Really, you don’t need to be teamviewed for every issue.
[/quote]I did download the cache and put it in the client folder and it still wont work
would be really helpful if you could teamview :)[/quote]
It may not need to go in the client folder.
Open signlink.java And search: findcachedir()
That will tell you the name of the cache and where it goes.

Read full topic
